tree
Class LinkedTree<E>

java.lang.Object
  tree.LinkedTree<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the element type.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<E>, Tree<E>
public class LinkedTree<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Tree<E>

The LinkedTree implements Tree interface. When a LinkedTree is first created, it contains no items.

Version:
1.0
Author:
SuperJulietta

addChild

public Position<E> addChild(E el,
                            Position<E> node)
Adds a child of a certain node in this LinkedTree.

Parameters:
el - The element to add as a child.
node - the parent's Position of the new child.
Returns:
The position of the added child.
Throws:
InvalidPositionException - if the parent's position is not a valid Position for this LinkedTree.

removeRoot

public E removeRoot()
Removes the root from this LinkedTree.

Returns:
the element stored(before removal)in the root
Throws:
EmptyTreeException - if invoked on an empty LinkedTree.
UndelatableNodeException - if invoked on a LinkedTree that does not contain only the root.

removeExternalChild

public E removeExternalChild(Position<E> node)
Removes the first leaf of a given node.

Parameters:
node - The parent's position.
Returns:
the element that was stored in the removed child.
Throws:
InvalidPositionException - if node is not a valid Position for this LinkedTree.
InvalidPositionException - if node is a leaf.
UndelatableNodeException - if the child of node is not a leaf.
